DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Maximum Standardized Uptake Value FDG-PET/CT Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Question that asks for the maximum standard uptake value (SUV) obtained through FDG-PET imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Maximum Standardized Uptake Value FDG-Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography of the Whole Body
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors._The largest possible quantity or degree._An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)]._Positron emission tomography combined with computed tomography of the whole body, with the use of the contrast agent fludeoxyglucose F 18 (18F-FDG) to enhance the image.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredName: Maximum Standardized Uptake Value FDG-Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography of the Whole Body
Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].:Positron emission tomography combined with computed tomography of the whole body, with the use of the contrast agent fludeoxyglucose F 18 (18F-FDG) to enhance the image.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.

An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].

Concepts.longName: FDG-Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography of the Whole Body
Concepts.definition: Positron emission tomography combined with computed tomography of the whole body, with the use of the contrast agent fludeoxyglucose F 18 (18F-FDG) to enhance the image.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Standard Uptake Value Positron Emission Tomography Assessment Maximum Measurement
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the maximum standard uptake value found during diagnostic imaging using PET.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
